Or there’s that slice of $8 cake you buy to assuage the Sunday scaries. I support you. Because sometimes I buy $14 peanut butter.But it’s not just any peanut butter. It’s Big Spoon Roasters’ Chai Spice peanut butter, which is a heavenly mixture of peanuts, almonds, cardamom, sugar, honey, clove, ginger, cinnamon, black pepper, vanilla, and Jacobsen sea salt. It evokes the same flavor profile as chai tea, and has lots of small crunchy bits that remind me of biting into a good, aged Parmesan. This peanut butter gets very close to straight-up dessert, but a nice salty hit helps bring it into sweet-or-savory land. Basically, this is the chunky peanut butter equivalent of fairies and cloudless 74° days and rainbows, but like…the indie, small-batch version of those things (the fairies definitely wear naturally dyed linen jumpsuits).It’s straight-out-of-the-jar good, but I prefer to really treat it right by spreading it (sparingly—I’m not a millionaire) on some toasted bread, perhaps with some thinly sliced banana. Or, as part of a brunch spread when you’re hosting guests, but only guests that you extra-special like or need to really cement a friendship with.So yeah, Big Spoon Roasters. Fairies and friendship. What could be better?Buy It: Big Spoon Roasters’ Chai Spice peanut butter, $14All products featured on Bonappetit.com are independently selected by our editors.
